ovdesc.p: When a loan or deposit contract in LD is input with currencies of the liquidation account being different from that of deal currency, this file is created by the system on authorisation of such contract. The @ID of the file is the @ID of the LD deal. This file is used to store the exchange rates applied / to be applied for liquidation, for various event dates and event currencies, read from the relevant LD deal. The exchange rates derived by the system is based on currencies of the liquidation accounts, Settlement Market, Conversion Type (all defaulted from the deal) and Protection Clause. The user may also input an exchange rate for each currency that is to be considered for every liquidation.
EVENT.DATE, EVENT.CCY, EV.SYS.RATE and EV.APPL.RATE are associated multivalue set of fields. Within this multivalue set EVENT.CCY, EV.SYS.RATE and EV.APPL.RATE are associated sub value set of fields.

The EV.SYS.RATE is updated with the system derived exhange rate.

The user may input the relevant exchange rate that is to be considered for liquidation in EV.APPL.RATE field. If the user has input any exchange rate in this field, the same would be used for liquidation and the system would continue to update its derived rate in EV.SYS.RATE.

desc.p: Represents the currency of liquidation for the event specified in LD deal. For example if principal liquidation should be from a DEM account while the deal is in GBP, this field will hold the value DEM.
This field is an associated multivalue field and would be multivalued only when multiple currencies are involved for an event date.
In this case alongwith EV.SYS.RATE and EV.APPL.RATE this field would be multivalued holding values DEM and CHF.
In this case the associated set of fields would not be multivalued and this field will hold value DEM.

The exchange rate for the event date for the event currency derived by the system. This field would be updated during END.OF.DAY or START.OF.DAY processing based on the setting in the field MATURE.SOD in LD deal.
For details on the basis of deriving the exchange rate please refer to the help text for CONVERSION.TYPE in LD deal.

If the exchange rate applicable for the event date and event currency needs to be specified, the user may input the value here. The exchange rate input here would be used for liquidation. The system would update its derived rate in EV.SYS.RATE field as usual.
Input allowed only on or prior to the event date for EOD maturity.
Input allowed only prior to event date for SOD maturity.

This associated multivalue set of fields is used to store the exchange rate and account used for each of the amount type at the time of first authorisation of LD deal. The purpose of writing these fields is to use the historic exchange rate and account for reversal of deals.

At the time of first authorisation, the drawdown & liquidation accounts over which accounting entries have been raised and the relevant exchange rates applied are captured. Should a deal be reversed, the reversal entries would be raised over the respective accounts at the respective exchange rate captured.
Represents a date for which an event (scheduled date) has been defined in the LD deal. The event could be principal liquidation, interest liquidation, commission liquidation etc.
Written from the LD Deal. If SETTLEMENT.MARKET needs to be changed, it has to be done at the LD deal. On authorisation the new value in LD deal would be written here.

The field can hold value YES or NO. If the field is flagged to YES, the system derived exchange rate for the event date for a particular currency would be compared with historic exchange rates applied for the currency and the best exchange rate (either current day's rate or one of the historic rates, whichever is more beneficial to the Bank) would be considered for liquidation.
If the field is flagged to NO, either the user input rate or the system derived rate (for no input by user) would be used for liquidation.
Input must be either YES or NO
Written from the LD deal. If value in this field needs to be changed, the change has to be done in the underlying LD deal. On authorisation of the LD deal, the new value would be written here.
For more details on the functionality, please refer to help text in LD deal for this field.
